page.normal_text:
All.Exp.Mtg 5/18/09 – A.Valishev
All.Exp.Mtg 5/18/09 – A.Valishev A l l . E x p . M t g 5 / 1 8 / 0 9
– A . V a l i s h e v
page.enlisting:
▪ Stability is the key to successful running in FY08 an FY09 ➢ Orbit stabilization ➢ Controlled antiproton emittance (or ea/ep ratio) ➢ Controlled proton tune ➢ Monitoring lattice stability ▪ With stable machine and beam parameters beam- ▪ Low-beta squeeze is the most demanding stage of the collider cycle ➢ Losses are caused by long range beam-beam effects ➢ Increase of aperture in the CDF IR improved situation ➢ Chromaticity is a strong factor ▪ Further (though not large) improvements are possible: ▪ Stability is the key to successful running in FY08
▪ Stability is the key to successful running in FY08 ▪ S t a b i l i t y
